intro: Antirrhinum vexillocalyculatum var. breweri, commonly known as the Breweri's snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that typically range in color from red to orange. The plant features upright stems with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to arid environments, making it a resilient and visually striking species.
